dialr 0.2.0.9003
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Phone number validation in R

Source: R/dialr.R
dialr-package.Rd

dialr is an R interface to Google's libphonenumber library.

Overview

dialr is an R port of Google's libphonenumber library. It uses the java implementation of libphonenumber via rJava for all phone number processing.

For a full rundown of libphonenumber see their github and javadocs.

Options

  • dialr.home: The default region used to process phone numbers where no region is provided. (default: "AU").

  • dialr.format: The default format used to print clean phone numbers. See format.phone() for details. (default: "E164").

  • dialr.show_progress: Should lengthy operations such as phone() show a progress bar? (default: TRUE).

See also

Useful links:

  • https://github.com/socialresearchcentre/dialr

  • Report bugs at https://github.com/socialresearchcentre/dialr/issues

Other phone functions: dialr-phone, dialr-region, dialr-type, dialr-valid

Examples

library(dialr)

# Parse phone number vector
x <- c(0, 0123, "0404 753 123", "61410123817")
x <- phone(x, "AU")

is_parsed(x)    # Was the phone number successfully parsed?
#> [1] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE
is_valid(x)     # Is the phone number valid?
#> [1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE
is_possible(x)  # Is the phone number possible?
#> [1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE
get_region(x)   # What region (ISO country code) is the phone number from?
#> [1] NA   NA   "AU" "AU"
get_type(x)     # Is the phone number a fixed line, mobile etc.
#> [1] NA        "UNKNOWN" "MOBILE"  "MOBILE" 
format(x)
#> [1] NA             "+61123"       "+61404753123" "+61410123817"
format(x, home = "AU")
#> [1] NA           "123"        "0404753123" "0410123817"
